Base:Descriptions.Base:Description: a painting of a barren, desolate field

A barren, flat strip of land stretches across your vision, terminating grimly against the horizon. The sky reflects the landscape with a pale, brittle blue tinged in a sickly mottled yellow, the sun baking the ground with its harsh rays. A myriad of rocks are strewn haphazardly over the murky, ash-gray landscape; tufts of mustard colored grass break through the ground in places, desperately clinging to life. A violent, vibrant spot of color bursts forth from the center of the waste, a single brilliantly green flower spurting impossibly from the devastation. Perched atop the long, green stem sits a fully circular spread of long, white petals, framing the dappled yellow pistil as a crown tops the head of a king, reaching exultantly toward the sky, thriving in the desolate land despite the odds. At the base of the flower you notice the beginnings of a few smaller plants, still in their infancy but being coaxed to life through sheer will.
This painting appears to be of average quality.
In the lower right corner you see a large G in red, as the only signature.
A painting of a barren, desolate field.
